text:
*My kryptonite is cover letters.* I hate them with a passion that rivals The Joker’s hatred of Batman.
As a writer, I am completely baffled as to why I can’t seem to get it right. This has been plaguing me for literally YEARS, and I’m pretty sure that it has negatively impacted my job searches at least somewhat.
I’ve read what feels like every article and tried what feels like every “method” and everything I produce feels super disingenuous, completely useless, and more of a detraction than a way to help “sell” my qualifications, etc.
Any advice? I am paralyzed with anxiety over cover letters and don’t want to

PS: If it matters, I will be looking for more senior roles (director, lead, etc.); I am currently a senior manager (acting director), and I think my experience/resume are pretty solid. . .

text: Hiya <@U01JP5NAGKT>, I hear your pain. Nothing worse than getting stuck on something that you know should be easy and flow naturally. Personally, I find it best to have my cover letter as an overview-intro to the rest of my CV. I'll pop you my CV - via DM - in Powerpoint format, so you can edit as you see fit. Hopefully it works for you.
